instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, there was no green light then i notice <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> not good, i changed it , now green light , and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> im getting 14.-15 v, b4 doing all the work i took out f7040 fuse, 



why its 14.5 v ? what do i check

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
threads.message:
Your multimeter's batteries are dead. Fucked up <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> will cause battery not charging or quarter fan spin, <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> are the only ones that will cause voltage change, and that's voltage [I]drop[/I], not increase. 

Is it turning on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
threads.message: all <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR>.... is good, yes it turns on if i connect the the fuse... i didnt run it more then one min what if 14v do some harm,.... my multimeter is good...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
threads.message: louissssssssss  i fixed it ..!!!!!! <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> was disconnected from <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>,,.... i had to do jumper.... chk picture!!!!!

threads.message: Good work, just one advice, don't run wires over ISL, go around it....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
threads.message: now everything is fine but battery not charging... computer work all good, no yellow light , green light on all the time.. any advice?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
threads.message: did you try a smc reset? If nothing happens...check <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pins 27/28 on resistance mode and write down values 17/18 pins too, I had the same problem on the same board 2 days ago.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
threads.message: As I told you from the first time, check sense resistors and traces of course, also check voltage on pins 4 and 6 from J6950, both should have about 3.4V......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
threads.message: [COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]<SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> pin from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> going to <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> good, and 12v, which should be 5 v to turn on <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>.  why <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> 12V???[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
threads.message: Could be a bad battery too.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
threads.message: Can you measure resistance on <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> (one probe on pin 1 the other in pin 2), report value...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 14.24v!!
threads.message: check current sensing circuit for charger as well. if it charges when it is OFF but not when it is ON, <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>/traces between them may be broken
